content:
• Tuesday, January 29, 2013
  • DLB

    More on Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB): FQ1 beats across the board on essentially flat revenue growth...

    More on Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB): FQ1 beats across the board on essentially flat revenue growth over the prior period. For Q2, the company guides revenue in the range of $240M to $250M and an EPS of around $0.68 to $0.75. The Street is at $251M in revenue and earnings of $0.73 per share. Shares +3.5% AH

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM
  • CHK

    Carl Icahn offers kind words for Aubrey McClendon as the Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) CEO heads...

    Carl Icahn offers kind words for Aubrey McClendon as the Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) CEO heads for the door: "Aubrey has every right to be proud of the company he has built... and the collection of assets he has assembled... the best portfolio of energy assets in the country." CHK +10.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:28 PM | 12 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) announces a $55M secondary offering, with a 30-day option...

    Keryx Biopharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KERX) announces a $55M secondary offering, with a 30-day option to the book-runner on another 15% of the number of shares sold. The company plans to use the net proceeds to fund its upcoming launch of Zerenex in Q2. J.P. Morgan is acting as the sole book-runner. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:10 PM
  • UIS

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: UIS +12%. AMZN +8%. CHK +8%. FTNT +7%. DLB +5%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: UIS +12%. AMZN +8%. CHK +8%. FTNT +7%. DLB +5%.
    After-hours top losers: CIE -9%. RCL -5%. ISIS -5%. ACE -5%. GGG -4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:47 PM | 5 Comments
  • ASMB

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS) announces a concurrent secondary offering to sell shares of its...

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS) announces a concurrent secondary offering to sell shares of its common stock, and shares of its Series A Convertible Preferred Stock in a separate underwritten public offering. Shares -7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:45 PM
  • AVGO

    Broadcom Corporation (BRCM) declares $0.11/share quarterly dividend, 10% increase from prior...

    Broadcom Corporation (BRCM) declares $0.11/share quarterly dividend, 10% increase from prior dividend of $0.10. Forward yield 1.31%. For shareholders of record Feb. 15. Payable Mar. 04. Ex-div date Feb. 13. Shares -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • CHK

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) says Aubrey McClendon will retire as CEO effective April 1. The CHK...

    Chesapeake Energy (NYSE:CHK) says Aubrey McClendon will retire as CEO effective April 1. The CHK board says its extensive review of alleged conflicts of interest and other matters involving McClendon has thus far found no improper conduct; a final report will be completed in mid-February. CHK +10.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 20 Comments
  • VRTX

    More on Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q4 beats consensus estimates, but total revenue...

    More on Vertex Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:VRTX): Q4 beats consensus estimates, but total revenue dropped by over 38% Y/Y on a plummet in Incivek sales, which came in at $222.8M versus $456.8M the previous year. In December of last year the Hep-C drug was hit by an FDA "Black Box" warning over a potentially fatal skin rash that could occur in patients taking the medication. Shares -2.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM
  • WBSN

    Websense (NASDAQ:WBSN): Q4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $91.7M beats by $0.69M....

    Websense (NASDAQ:WBSN): Q4 EPS of $0.28 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $91.7M beats by $0.69M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • WAIR

    Wesco Aircraft (NYSE:WAIR): FQ1 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $211.2M (+9.7% Y/Y)...

    Wesco Aircraft (NYSE:WAIR): FQ1 EPS of $0.25 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $211.2M (+9.7% Y/Y) misses by $5.15M. Shares -3.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM
  • MANH

    Manhattan Associates (NASDAQ:MANH): Q4 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $95.4M beats by...

    Manhattan Associates (NASDAQ:MANH): Q4 EPS of $0.71 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $95.4M beats by $3.18M. Shares +1.8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:40 PM
  • UIS

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q4 EPS of $2.27 beats by $1.2. Revenue of $979M (-1% Y/Y) beats by $55.1M....

    Unisys (NYSE:UIS): Q4 EPS of $2.27 beats by $1.2. Revenue of $979M (-1% Y/Y) beats by $55.1M. Shares +8.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM
  • PLT

    Plantronics (NYSE:PLT): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $197.4M (+8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Plantronics (NYSE:PLT): Q4 EPS of $0.73 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $197.4M (+8% Y/Y) beats by $11.35M. Shares +2.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM
  • CY

    Spansion (CODE): Q4 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.02. Non-Gaap Revenue of $224M misses by $10.4M....

    Spansion (CODE): Q4 EPS of $0.34 misses by $0.02. Non-Gaap Revenue of $224M misses by $10.4M. Shares -7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • AZPN

    Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $77.3M (+16% Y/Y)...

    Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN): Q4 EPS of $0.13 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $77.3M (+16% Y/Y) beats by $9.33M. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • HTCH

    Hutchinson Technology (NASDAQ:HTCH): FQ1 EPS of -$0.19 beats by $0.29. Revenue of $63.7M misses...

    Hutchinson Technology (NASDAQ:HTCH): FQ1 EPS of -$0.19 beats by $0.29. Revenue of $63.7M misses by $0.73M. Shares +7.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • AMZN

    More on Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q4: The company swung back from its Q3 loss as North America...

    More on Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) Q4: The company swung back from its Q3 loss as North America sales rose 23% Y/Y to $12.175B and International sales gained 21% to reach $9.093B. Growth in the company's Electronics segment outpaced Media segment sales. Free cash flow decreased 81% to $395M for the trailing twelve month period compared to a year ago with real estate outlays factoring in. For Q1, the company sees $15.0B-$16.6B in revenue and expects profit to fall in a range of -$285M to $65M. A conference call is scheduled for 5:00 EST. AMZN changes direction, now  +3.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM | 98 Comments
  • DLB

    Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB): FQ1 EPS of $0.64 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $236.6M (+1% Y/Y) beats by...

    Dolby Labs (NYSE:DLB): FQ1 EPS of $0.64 beats by $0.08. Revenue of $236.6M (+1% Y/Y) beats by $15.6M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -9.4%) and Western Digital (WDC -5.2%) close with big losses after the former...

    Seagate (STX -9.4%) and Western Digital (WDC -5.2%) close with big losses after the former issued soft guidance to go with its FQ2 beat. EMC's guidance might be making a bad situation worse. FBN and Evercore have downgraded Seagate, which is trading around ~6x FY13E EPS even if one assumes consensus forecasts fall a bit. Management noted on the earnings call it expects hard drive industry volumes to be flat-to-down Q/Q, but added cloud-related sales remain a bright spot. LSI-OLD -2.3%. FIO -5.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN): Q4 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $21.27B (+27% Y/Y) misses by...

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN): Q4 EPS of $0.21 misses by $0.07. Revenue of $21.27B (+27% Y/Y) misses by $101M. Shares -6.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 11 Comments
  • SPPI

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +4.6%) finishes the day higher after saying late yesterday that...

    Spectrum Pharmaceuticals (SPPI +4.6%) finishes the day higher after saying late yesterday that safety findings from its Phase 2 trial of belinostat showed an acceptable profile in patients with relapsed T-cell lymphoma.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:02 PM | 5 Comments
  • X

    U.S. Steel (X -2%) and AK Steel (AKS -1.8%) (I, II) continue to contend with oversupply in...

    U.S. Steel (X -2%) and AK Steel (AKS -1.8%) (I, II) continue to contend with oversupply in the U.S. industry, pressuring steel prices, but both companies expect results to improve in the current quarter as the global economy improves. "Recent increases in our daily order entry rates suggest increased spot market demand as the quarter progresses," U.S. Steel says, also seeing lower coal costs for 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • GPT

    Gramercy Capital (GKK +4%) pops to its highest level in nearly 2 years as Chris DeMuth makes the...

    Gramercy Capital (GKK +4%) pops to its highest level in nearly 2 years as Chris DeMuth makes the case for the stock on Bloomberg (his article on SA from Dec.). The next catalyst, he says, will be the sale of its CDO exposure - a bit of a nemesis for a small shop like Gramercy, but of great value for a larger business.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM | 6 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD +1.8%) spikes to $13.26 after the FT reports Silver Lake is willing to pay...

    Dell (DELL-OLD +1.8%) spikes to $13.26 after the FT reports Silver Lake is willing to pay $15/share. Would that be enough to satisfy shareholders who view a $13-$14/share offer as inadequate? (more) Update: The WSJ reports Microsoft's (NASDAQ:MSFT) role in the deal remains one of several issues that need to be worked out. However, sources insist the deal remains on track.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:47 PM | 5 Comments
  • AEZS

    Shares of AEterna Zentaris (AEZS +18.5%) shares rocket higher in afternoon trading on the back...

    Shares of AEterna Zentaris (AEZS +18.5%) shares rocket higher in afternoon trading on the back of cancer drug peer Keryx Pharmaceuticals (KERX +40%) big gains. Volumes are extremely high in AEZS today, with over 4M shares changing hands, compared to the daily average of around 850K.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:23 PM | 3 Comments
  • ASH

    A major factor in Ashland's (ASH -6.3%) earnings miss was a dramatic price drop of straight...

    A major factor in Ashland's (ASH -6.3%) earnings miss was a dramatic price drop of straight guar, which soared in value early last year due to demand from energy firms using it in fracking. But the bubble burst after a demand surge pushed prices to $27K/ton in May, and the ingredient fetched only $7K/ton by December. "The inventory issue with straight guar is now behind us," CEO James O'Brien says.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 1 Comment
  • CPIX

    Cumberland Pharmaceuticals (CPIX +3.4%) gains today after it enters into an exclusive agreement...

    Cumberland Pharmaceuticals (CPIX +3.4%) gains today after it enters into an exclusive agreement with Indonesia's SOHO Industri Pharmasi for the Indonesian marketing of its of Caldolor Injection, which is used to treat pain and fever in hospitals. The deal gives SOHO an exclusive license, leaving it responsible for regulatory approval, reporting, product marketing, distribution and sales once approved. In exchange, CPIX will receive upfront and milestone payments, as well as transfer prices on future drug sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • CEMI

    Shares of Chembio Diagnostics (CEMI +4.2%) moves higher after the USDA approves its CervidTB...

    Shares of Chembio Diagnostics (CEMI +4.2%) moves higher after the USDA approves its CervidTB STAT-PAK and DPP VetTB test kits as primary and secondary tests for bovine tuberculosis by the USDA Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service. The approval was made in order to provide the farmed deer industry with more options for meeting testing requirements for captive elk and deer.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • VLO

    Valero's (VLO +11.4%) "best quarter in years" is broadly lifting shares of other refiners: TSO...

    Valero's (VLO +11.4%) "best quarter in years" is broadly lifting shares of other refiners: TSO +4.5%, PSX +4.6%, HFC +5.7%, WNR +5.1%, MPC +4.9%. VLO's switch away from imported light, sweet crude toward domestic sources was anticipated but came earlier than expected, and represents a milestone in a U.S. energy industry hoping for self-sufficiency.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 6 Comments
  • ZNGA

    After rocketing higher yesterday (apparently thanks to the $9B valuation given to Twitter by...

    After rocketing higher yesterday (apparently thanks to the $9B valuation given to Twitter by BlackRock), Zynga (ZNGA -7.6%) is giving back a big chunk of those gains today. Groupon (GRPN -2.3%) is also retracing its steps a bit. Zynga still has a sizable short interest, but it's well below last summer's peak. The company's Q4 report is due on Feb. 5, and Groupon's on Feb. 27. Facebook reports tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM | 6 Comments

  • Canadian microcap drug developer Theratechnologies (THER +17.7%) gets a pop today after the...

    Canadian microcap drug developer Theratechnologies (THER +17.7%) gets a pop today after the USPTO grants a patent for its second generation growth-hormone releasing factor peptide, TH1173, and provides for patent protection beyond 2030. The company adds that preclinical studies for the drug are now completed, and warrant the pursuit of further clinical stage development.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • EQIX

    Equinix (EQIX -2.6%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral from Citi's Michael Rollins. Though raising...

    Equinix (EQIX -2.6%) slips on a downgrade to Neutral from Citi's Michael Rollins. Though raising his PT to $240 from $220, Rollins is cutting his 2013 and 2014 adjusted funds from operations (AFFO) forecasts on a belief capex and tax rates will be higher than previously expected, and that Equinix will be unable to become a REIT before 2015. He also considers Equinix's risk-reward more balanced following a huge run-up. Q4 results arrive on Feb. 13. Rival Rackspace (RAX -4.5%) is seeing bigger losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • E

    Eni (E -3%) shares are hit after revised guidance from subsidiary Saipem (OTCPK:SAPMY) affecting...

    Eni (E -3%) shares are hit after revised guidance from subsidiary Saipem (OTCPK:SAPMY) affecting 2012 and 2013 results. For FY 2012, EBIT is forecast to come in ~6% lower than expected, at ~€1.5B and net income at ~€900M; for FY 2013, EBIT is forecast to drop ~80% Y/Y. Earlier, Reuters reported Eni is in talks with Iraq to cut its production target at the Zubair oilfield.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • ANAC

    Deutsche Bank weighs in on Anacor's (ANAC -22.5%) weakness on its tavaborole Phase 3 data...

    Deutsche Bank weighs in on Anacor's (ANAC -22.5%) weakness on its tavaborole Phase 3 data release, saying that ANAC's patient population may have been older and less healthy versus Valeant's (VRX +0.8%) Phase 3 trials, and its mycological cure rate was actually superior to VRX's results.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:46 PM | 1 Comment
  • BZH

    Beazer Homes (BZH +4.9%) moves up today in spite of posting a mixed FQ1 report earlier, beating...

    Beazer Homes (BZH +4.9%) moves up today in spite of posting a mixed FQ1 report earlier, beating on its bottom line but coming up slightly short on revenue expectations. Net profit actually swung to a loss as the home builder's year-ago results were boosted by a larger income-tax benefit, though total revenue grew by 31% in the latest period on a 20% jump in total home closings. Cancellation rates also came down to 26.4% from 35.1%, while new orders rose 29% to 932 homes.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:31 PM
  • SWI

    High-beta enterprise IT names continue to sell off (previous) after EMC, VMware, and BMC...

    High-beta enterprise IT names continue to sell off (previous) after EMC, VMware, and BMC Software all provide disappointing guidance. Both EMC and VMware's earnings calls (I, II) were peppered with cautious remarks about the global IT spending environment. BMC rivals ServiceNow (SWI -4.5%) and SolarWinds (SWI -4.5%) are among the casualties. Others: RVBD -4.1%. CVLT -3.4%. CTXS -2.7%. FIRE -6.2%. QLIK -2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • STCN

    Midday top 10 gainers: MLNK +32%. KERX +30%. SOMH +25%. VTUS +24%. MHH +14%. SWIR +14%. AEZS...

    Midday top 10 gainers: MLNK +32%. KERX +30%. SOMH +25%. VTUS +24%. MHH +14%. SWIR +14%. AEZS +11%. CNIT-OLD +11%. IBCP +10%. SSBI +10%.
    Midday top 10 Losers: OXF -31%. ANAC -21%. VMW -20%. SANM -18%. OCZ -18%. LXK -15%. CTC -13%. GIG -12%. NTGR -11%. SHIP -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • ASMB

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS +26%) continues on a tear today, extending gains for a second day...

    Ventrus Biosciences (VTUS +26%) continues on a tear today, extending gains for a second day after the biotech company confirmed last week that it has sufficient cash to complete development of VEN307, its anal fissure drug candidate.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • BB

    RIM (RIMM -6.3%) is falling hard again ahead of tomorrow's BB10 event, where the Z10 and X10 are...

    RIM (RIMM -6.3%) is falling hard again ahead of tomorrow's BB10 event, where the Z10 and X10 are expected to be unveiled. Critical comments from UBS and CLSA could be playing a role - the former declares BB10 price points too high for emerging markets, and thinks iOS and Android have a stranglehold elsewhere. On the flip side, OTR Global thinks a Lenovo partnership could be announced soon; Lenovo recently declared comments about a possible RIM bid to be taken out of context. The WSJ has taken a look at the challenges RIM faces in winning back corporate clients.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM | 16 Comments
  • HOV

    Shares of Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV +3.5%) get a boost today from an upgrade to Neutral from...

    Shares of Hovnanian Enterprises (HOV +3.5%) get a boost today from an upgrade to Neutral from Compass Point. The firm says HOV's risk profile has declined markedly over the past few quarters and there's room for sustainable profitability in 2014. It cautions, however, that the company will not achieve a positive book value until its DTA is reversed in perhaps 2015-2016, and its equity value remains dependent upon that metric improving.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • FTNT

    Fortinet (FTNT -5.5%) heads south following a downgrade to Hold from Wunderlich; the firm is...

    Fortinet (FTNT -5.5%) heads south following a downgrade to Hold from Wunderlich; the firm is worried about competitive pressures, and sees downside risk to consensus Q1 and 2013 estimates. JMP downgraded the UTM security hardware leader a week ago on competitive grounds. EMC and VMware's guidance might also be pressuring shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -2.4%) slumps after Wedbush downgrades shares to Neutral, albeit while lifting its PT...

    Pandora (P -2.4%) slumps after Wedbush downgrades shares to Neutral, albeit while lifting its PT to $11.50. The firm expresses concerns about "valuation, competition, and royalty rates," but is also encouraged by an improving ad landscape and continued Web/mobile growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • TSL

    Trina (TSL +2.6%) adds to its recent gains after announcing a deal to supply 30MW of modules for...

    Trina (TSL +2.6%) adds to its recent gains after announcing a deal to supply 30MW of modules for two South African solar projects; deliveries will be made in Q3. Shares are up 130% from their Nov. 20 close. (solar plant comments)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM | 2 Comments
  • PFE

    More from Pfizer's (PFE +2.8%) earnings call: CEO Ian Read says the drug maker is separated into...

    More from Pfizer's (PFE +2.8%) earnings call: CEO Ian Read says the drug maker is separated into two business models: one focused on patent-protected drugs and the other on off-patent drugs. Read calls them "innovative" and "value" businesses, each with separate management. He adds that the company has yet to determine whether shareholders are interested in investing in two distinct companies or not, which leaves the door open to further potential spinoffs.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW -20.2%) has been hit by 7 downgrades in response to its poor Q1/2013 guidance....

    VMware (VMW -20.2%) has been hit by 7 downgrades in response to its poor Q1/2013 guidance. VMware's soft transactional (individual license) sales "will raise questions about the appetite for SMB customers to expand their virtualization footprint," says Goldman, which has removed shares from its Conviction Buy list. However, the firm has "yet to pick up on any material changes in the competitive landscape" in this segment. "We'd buy the shares after the smoke clears," says Oppenheimer, viewing guidance as conservative. (also) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • BTU

    It was "a messy release" for Peabody Energy (BTU +6.3%), which swung to a sizable Q4 loss as it...

    It was "a messy release" for Peabody Energy (BTU +6.3%), which swung to a sizable Q4 loss as it posted significant charges related to write-downs and mine-closure costs, while revenue also dropped. But operations in the western U.S. surprised to the upside and Australian volumes were much higher than expected, while costs were lower than expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • PFE

    Pfizer (PFE +2.8%) trades up today on a solid Q4 report which benefited from a surge in profit...

    Pfizer (PFE +2.8%) trades up today on a solid Q4 report which benefited from a surge in profit from the sale of its nutrition unit, and largely offset a 7% decline in its Lipitor sales due to generic competition. In its call, the company pointed to other drugs coming to market that it hopes will offset Lipitor, including Xeljanz, a new treatment for rheumatoid arthritis that was approved by the FDA in November, and Eliquis, an anticlotting drug that was cleared in late December. FY13 forecast brackets Street estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM
  • OCZ

    OCZ (OCZ -13.6%) and (to a lesser extent STEC (STEC -3.7%) sell off following soft guidance from...

    OCZ (OCZ -13.6%) and (to a lesser extent STEC (STEC -3.7%) sell off following soft guidance from EMC and Seagate. Seagate's $40M investment in and reseller deal with PCI-Express server flash card maker Virident might also be taking a toll. QLogic (QLGC -1.3%), Mellanox (MLNX -2%), Brocade (BRCD -1%), Micron (MU -1.7%), and SanDisk (SNDK -0.9%) are posting moderate declines.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • BSX

    Boston Scientific (BSX +5%) gains on a healthy beat to its Q4 bottom line this morning, despite...

    Boston Scientific (BSX +5%) gains on a healthy beat to its Q4 bottom line this morning, despite net earnings falling 44% Y/Y as the medical-device maker was hit by higher restructuring-related charges. Revenue was down slightly as declines in cardiology products offset growth in other areas. The company gave upbeat guidance for FY13, now expecting to earn between $7.05B to $7.35B, compared with the $7.12B expected by the Street, and announced a $1B share buyback.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • TROW

    More on T. Rowe Price (TROW -1.6%) Q4 earnings: AUM increased to $576.8B from $574.4B in Q3, but...

    More on T. Rowe Price (TROW -1.6%) Q4 earnings: AUM increased to $576.8B from $574.4B in Q3, but only thanks to market gains as a net $4.2B was withdrawn from the company's funds. The firm's stock-picking ability remains, with 74% of its funds outperforming Lipper averages in 2012. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • DDD

    Hammered yesterday following a critical SA column and ExOne's IPO filing, 3D Systems (DDD +4.8%)...

    Hammered yesterday following a critical SA column and ExOne's IPO filing, 3D Systems (DDD +4.8%) and Stratasys (SSYS +2.4%) are rebounding a bit today. 3D issued a PR yesterday afternoon stating it won't comment on "unusual market activity," and announced the launch of 8 new ProJet 3500 professional 3D printers this morning.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:46 AM | 10 Comments
  • LLY

    Eli Lilly (LLY +2%) moves up today after its Q4 beat across the board. Total revenue and net...

    Eli Lilly (LLY +2%) moves up today after its Q4 beat across the board. Total revenue and net sales both declined Y/Y however, as Zyprexa's patent expiration weighed on results. Sales of the drug declined by 49%, but were offset somewhat by a surge in sales of Cymbalta, which jumped by jumped 20% to $1.42B and animal-health sales, which rose 18% to $554.1M. For FY13, Lilly expects to earn between $4.10 to $4.25 per share on sales of $22.6B to $23.4B. Street estimates are for $3.83 on revenue of $22.93B.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • CNTF

    China Techfaith (CNTF +10.5%) jumps after announcing a deal with Israeli motion sensor developer...

    China Techfaith (CNTF +10.5%) jumps after announcing a deal with Israeli motion sensor developer PrimeSense. Techfaith's 17FOX motion sensor IP unit will work with PrimeSense to develop, market, and merchandize games and apps leveraging PrimeSense's motion controllers in China. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:21 AM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -7.8%) opens with a thud after badly missing Q4 EPS estimates. Also hurting is Q1...

    Lexmark (LXK -7.8%) opens with a thud after badly missing Q4 EPS estimates. Also hurting is Q1 guidance for an 11%-13% revenue drop and EPS of $0.80-$0.90, largely below a consensus for an 11.3% drop and EPS of $1.01. Q4 gross margin was 34.1%, -160 bps Q/Q and -330 bps Y/Y. Hardware revenue -15% Y/Y, supplies -10%. Software sales +25%, but were only 9% of total. Shares had rallied strongly since July, fueled by enthusiasm over Lexmark's restructuring efforts. Rivals are off: HPQ -1.8%. XRX -1.5%. (PR) (slides)
